title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must show appropriate work in order to receive the point.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate Dana’s total benefit from purchasing 2 bottles of water and 1 unit of good X as $66 and/or does not show the work.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must show appropriate work in order to receive the point.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate Dana’s total consumer surplus from purchasing 3 units of good X as $39 and/or does not show the work.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response to part (c) (i) must use marginal analysis in the explanation in order to receive the point.

The response to part (c) (iii) must show appropriate work in order to receive the point.

The response to part (c) (iii) must be consistent with (c)(ii).
descriptions:
The response does none of the following.

· Explains that Dana does not maximize her benefit because the marginal utility per dollar spent on bottles of water is greater than the marginal utility per dollar spent on good X.

( 18/$3 > 6/$6; OR 6 > 1; OR 6≠ 1; OR MB W /P W >MB X /P X MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeymaiaabI dacaqGVaGaaeijaiaabodacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqG2aGaae4l aiaabscacaqG2aGaae4oaiaabccacaqGpbGaaeOuaiaabccacaqG2a Gaaeiiaiaab6dacaqGGaGaaeymaiaabUdacaqGGaGaae4taiaabkfa caqGGaGaaeOnaiabgcMi5kaabgdacaqG7aGaaeiiaiaab+eacaqGsb Gaaeiiaiaab2eacaqGcbWaaSbaaSqaaiaabEfaaeqaaOGaae4laiaa bcfadaWgaaWcbaGaae4vaaqabaGccaqG+aGaaeytaiaabkeadaWgaa WcbaGaaeiwaaqabaGccaqGVaGaaeiuamaaBaaaleaacaqGybaabeaa aaa@5B19@ )

· States that the optimal quantities of good X and bottles of water are 3 units and 4 bottles respectively.

· Calculates the cross-price elasticity of demand for bottles of water with respect to the price of good X, shows the work, and states that the goods are complements.

% change in the quantity of bottles of water  /  % change in the price of good X   =  25% / –50%  = –0.5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaadaqada qaaabaaaaaaaaapeGaaeyjaiaabccacaqGJbGaaeiAaiaabggacaqG UbGaae4zaiaabwgacaqGGaGaaeyAaiaab6gacaqGGaGaaeiDaiaabI gacaqGLbGaaeiiaiaabghacaqG1bGaaeyyaiaab6gacaqG0bGaaeyA aiaabshacaqG5bGaaeiiaiaab+gacaqGMbGaaeiiaiaabkgacaqGVb GaaeiDaiaabshacaqGSbGaaeyzaiaabohacaqGGaGaae4BaiaabAga caqGGaGaae4DaiaabggacaqG0bGaaeyzaiaabkhaa8aacaGLOaGaay zkaaWdbiaabccacaqGVaGaaeiia8aadaqadaqaa8qacaqGLaGaaeii aiaabogacaqGObGaaeyyaiaab6gacaqGNbGaaeyzaiaabccacaqGPb GaaeOBaiaabccacaqG0bGaaeiAaiaabwgacaqGGaGaaeiCaiaabkha caqGPbGaae4yaiaabwgacaqGGaGaae4BaiaabAgacaqGGaGaae4zai aab+gacaqGVbGaaeizaiaabccacaqGybaapaGaayjkaiaawMcaa8qa caqGGaaabaGaaeypaiaabccapaWaaeWaaeaapeGaaeOmaiaabwdaca qGLaGaaeiiaiaab+cacaqGGaGaae4eGiaabwdacaqGWaGaaeyjaaWd aiaawIcacaGLPaaapeGaaeiiaiaab2dacaqGGaGaae4eGiaabcdaca qGUaGaaeynaaaaaa@8BB5@
